articles.author: JOSH BOAK, STEPHEN GROVES and LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The White House is preparing Friday to direct federal agencies to get ready for a shutdown after House Republicans left town for the weekend with no viable plan to keep the government funded and avert politically and economically costly disruption of federal services.
articles.title: White House preparing for government shutdown as House Republicans lack a viable endgame for funding

articles.author: DAVID KOENIG
articles.description: The United Auto Workers union expanded its strike against major carmakers Friday, walking out of 38 parts-distribution centers operated by General Motors and Jeep and Ram owner Stellantis in 20 states.
articles.title: Auto workers are expanding their strike to 38 locations in 20 states, targeting Stellantis and GM

articles.author: JAKE OFFENHARTZ, ERIC TUCKER and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Sen. Bob Menendez was charged Friday with secretly aiding the authoritarian regime of Egypt and trying to thwart the criminal prosecution of a friend in exchange for gold bars and cash as prosecutors unsealed a corruption indictment that accuses him of using his foreign affairs influence for personal gain.
articles.title: Sen. Menendez, wife indicted on bribe charges as probe finds $100,000 in gold bars, prosecutors say

articles.author: LAURAN NEERGAARD
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Surgeons have transplanted a pig’s heart into a dying man in a bid to prolong his life – only the second patient to ever undergo such an experimental feat. Two days later, the man was cracking jokes and able to sit in a chair, Maryland doctors said Friday.
articles.title: Surgeons perform second pig heart transplant, trying to save a dying man

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB and DASHA LITVINOVA
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine struck the headquarters of Russia’s Black Sea Fleet in a missile attack Friday that left a serviceman missing and the main building smoldering, according to military officials on both sides of the war and images from the scene in Crimea.
articles.title: A Ukrainian missile strikes the headquarters of Russia's navy in Crimea

articles.description: UNITED NATIONS (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told the U.N. General Assembly on Friday that Israel is “at the cusp” of a historic breakthrough leading to a peace agreement with Saudi Arabia, without outlining a clear path over the significant obstacles facing such an accord.
articles.title: Netanyahu tells UN that Israel is 'at the cusp' of a historic agreement with Saudi Arabia

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A military judge at Guantanamo Bay has ruled one of the 9/11 defendants unfit for trial after a military medical panel found that the man's sustained abuse in CIA custody years earlier has rendered him lastingly psychotic.
articles.title: A 9/11 defendant is ruled unfit for trial after a medical panel finds torture left him psychotic

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD and SYLVIE CORBET
articles.description: MARSEILLE, France (AP) — Pope Francis blasted the “fanaticism of indifference” that greets migrants seeking a better life, as he arrived Friday in the Mediterranean port of Marseille amid a new influx of would-be refugees from Africa that has sparked a backlash from some of Europe’s increasingly anti-migrant leaders.
articles.title: Pope decries indifference toward migrants, as he prays for the dead in the French port of Marseille

articles.author: SARAH BRUMFIELD and BRIAN WITTE
articles.description: ANNAPOLIS, Md. (AP) — Tropical Storm Ophelia formed off the mid-Atlantic coast and was expected to bring heavy rain, storm surge and windy conditions over the weekend, the National Hurricane Center said Friday.
articles.title: Tropical Storm Ophelia forms off the US mid-Atlantic coast, expected to bring heavy rain and wind

articles.author: JILL LAWLESS and PAN PYLAS
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Before he hit America, Rupert Murdoch ripped through Britain’s media like a tornado.His newspapers changed the political and cultural weather and swung elections. His satellite television channels upended the staid broadcasting scene.
articles.title: Hero or villain? Rupert Murdoch’s exit stirs strong feelings in Britain, where he upended the media
